business.headline: Explained: Why the IMF is under fire for $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

India–Pakistan tensions escalate. What's next for Dalal Street investors?While the Sensex and Nifty ended over 1% lower in the previous session, experts suggest that the decline was far less than what could have been expected in such a volatile environment.

Nirmala Sitharama asks banks to stay on alert amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsThe directive comes a day after India successfully intercepted multiple missile and drone attacks launched from Pakistan late on May 8. While India reported no major damage, the government has since asked all critical institutions to bolster their cybersecurity infrastructure in anticipation of potential retaliatory attacks.
'Unsupportive stance towards India': Go Homestays ends ties with Turkish AirlinesGo Homestays ends ties with Turkish Airlines after Turkey backs Pakistan following 'Operation Sindoor'.

India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

entertainment.headline: Did Salman Khan make a post on India-Pakistan ceasefire and later delete it?Several screenshots of Salman Khan's X-post about the India-Pakistan ceasefire are going viral on social media. It seems like the Bollywood superstar posted about the ceasefire on Saturday and deleted it later.

Big B breaks silence on Operation Sindoor after series of blank posts on XAmitabh Bachchan made a long, emotional, and empowering note about Operation Sindoor, mentioning the woman who lost her husband and asked a terrorist to kill her as well. The actor shared his father's poetry in the post. His post comes almost 20 days after the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

No Bhool Chuk Maaf's release till next hearing on June 16: Bombay courtPVR sued Maddock Films, the production house, for cancelling the release of 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' citing Indo-Pak conflict. Now, Bombay High Court has restrained the film's release till the next hearing, which will take place on June 16.

Actor Nimrat Kaur on Indo-Pak conflict: Terrorism has no placeActor Nimrat Kaur shared her personal journey as a martyr's daughter and highlighted the urgent need to address terrorism's root causes for lasting peace. She appealed to citizens to stay calm and support the armed forces amid Indo-Pak tensions.

Op Sindoor: Aamir Khan wants assurance of no attacks in future, Saif salutes armyAamir Khan, at a recent event, spoke about the Pahalgam attack and said that we, as a nation, would need assurance that such attacks will not happen again. Saif Ali Khan applauded the armed forces for their bravery and Operation Sindoor.

Telugu actor Nani reveals why he went ahead with HIT 3 event amid Indo-Pak tensionsTelugu actor Nani was called out for holding 'HIT 3' success event amid escalating Indo-Pak tensions. He stated that he didn't want to give terrorists the satisfaction of cancelling an event.

PVR sues Maddock Films after cancellation of Bhool Chuk Maaf theatrical releasePVR has sued Maddock Films for Rs 60 crore for the last-minute cancellation of the theatrical release of Bhool Chuk Maaf. Maddock Films is yet to release an official statement on the same.

Black, White and Gray: The uncomfortable fiction of this highly rated crime series'Black, White and Gray - Love Kills' is a gripping mockumentary series on SonyLIV that blurs the line between fiction and reality with its true-crime-style storytelling set in Nagpur. This six-episode show masterfully explores obsession and truth, leaving viewers questioning what is real in relationships and crime.

All about film on Operation Sindoor, makers' apology and clarificationFilmmaker Uttam Maheshwari deleted the poster of his film titled 'Operation Sindoor', and also apologised for hurting the sentiments of people, while India continues to defend its sovereignty amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

Rhea Chakraborty's moving tribute to Indian army: From one fauji home to another...Actor Rhea Chakraborty wrote an emotional and empowering note as the 'daughter' of an Indian army officer. She sent her love to the families of the soldiers who are fighting for the country amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

3 films, 3 different genres in Vijay Deverakonda's promising line-upActor Vijay Deverakonda announced his solid line-up of films on Friday. He shared the posters of the three films, indicating that the three belong to different genres.

When Nimrat Kaur recalled terrorists killing her father: Was kidnapped, terminatedActor Nimrat Kaur is the daughter of an army major who was martyred in 1994. In an interview, she once spoke about what she remembered from the day when she realised she had lost her father to terrorism.

Actors Khushbu, Radikaa Sarathukumar support Aarti over Ravi Mohan in divorce battleActors Khushbu Sundar and Radikaa Sarathkumar expressed their support for Aarti over actor Ravi Mohan in their divorce battle. This comes after Aarti's emotional yet strongly-worded statement following Ravi's latest public appearance with rumoured partner Kenishaa Francis.

Suits LA Season 2 cancelled after poor reviews: Report'Suits LA' Season 2 has been cancelled after the spin-off series received bad reviews and poor ratings upon its debut in February this year. The show has already premiered its 10 episodes.

Ram Charan receives warm welcome in London ahead of wax statue inauguration. PicsRam Charan's wax statue at Madame Tussauds London will be launched tomorrow. As he arrived in London, he received a loud cheers and warm welcome from his fans.

I'm nothing if not Indian: Hina Khan's strong note for trolls 'across the border'Hina Khan wrote a strongly-worded note against people 'across the border' who have been abusing her, cursing her and wishing the worst for her given her medical condition. She earlier expressed support for her country and the armed forces following Operation Sindoor against Pakistan-backed terrorism.

Indian cinema's queer journey: From margins to mainstreamIndian cinema has gradually shifted from stereotypical portrayals of queer characters to more authentic and nuanced stories. This evolution reflects broader social shifts and growing acceptance of queer identities in India.

Aamir Khan postpones Sitaare Zameen Par trailer launch amid Indo-Pak tensionsActor Aamir Khan has postponed the trailer release of his upcoming film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' amid rising India-Pakistan border tensions. The decision reflects solidarity with the armed forces and a call for national unity during sensitive times.

general news.headline: Will work with India, Pak for solution to Kashmir issue: Trump after ceasefireA day after Donald Trump announced that his country had brokered a ceasefire deal between India and Pakistan, the US President on Sunday said that he is looking forward to working with both countries to reach a solution on the Kashmir issue after a "thousand years."

Vance had to call PM Modi, US role limited to getting India and Pak to talk: CNNAs per CNN, US Vice President JD Vance had to call Prime Minister Narendra Modi to inform him about a "high probability of dramatic escalation" over the weekend.

Uski fitrat hai...: Shashi Tharoor's 'sher' skewers Pak over ceasefire flipAfter Pakistan breached the ceasefire despite peace talks, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor took a veiled jibe at the same and wrote on X that it is "his nature to turn away".

J&K on edge after Pak ceasefire breach; no firing, explosions overnightDespite Pakistan breaking the ceasefire deal within hours of it coming into effect, no firing or explosions were heard along the international borders through the night. However, Pakistani drones were spotted and blackouts were imposed in several areas.

All well in Pakistan, the land of confusion and coups?Minutes after Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif welcomed the ceasefire with India, without mentioning the word ceasefire, the Pakistani military started shelling and sending drones into Indian territory. Was General Asim Munir not agreeable to the ceasefire terms that the Sharif government must have agreed to? Is everything well within Pakistan, the land of confusion, contradictions and coups?

Live: Chidambaram praises PM Modi for ceasefire with Pak, calls it wise decisionIndia-Pakistan Tension Live Updates: Five hours after the foreign secretary Vikram Misri announced that India and Pakistan had reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea with immediate effect, reports of ceasefire violations by Pakistan surfaced.  Misri called upon Pakistan to take "appropriate steps" to address these violations and deal with the situation with "seriousness and responsibility". However, the situation along the LoC is stable now  while western border states are on high alert.

Shehbaz Sharif calls ceasefire deal with India a 'victory' for PakistanWhile addressing the nation, Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif accused India of using the April 22 Pahlagam attack as an "excuse" to launch an attack on the nation.

India snatched defeat from jaws of victory: Brahma Chellaney on ceasefire with PakTop geostrategist Brahma Chellaney criticised India's decision to agree to a ceasefire with Pakistan, calling it a repeat of past strategic mistakes. He argued that India had the upper hand militarily but gave up its advantage without securing long-term gains.

Big B breaks silence on Operation Sindoor after series of blank posts on XAmitabh Bachchan made a long, emotional, and empowering note about Operation Sindoor, mentioning the woman who lost her husband and asked a terrorist to kill her as well. The actor shared his father's poetry in the post. His post comes almost 20 days after the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

Janus-faced China condemns Pahalgam attack but backs 'friend' PakistanChina maintained a delicate diplomatic balance by reaffirming strong support for Pakistan and simultaneously condemning the Pahalgam terror attack in talks with India.

Great progress made: Trump says 'total reset' after trade talks with ChinaEarlier, top US and Chinese officials wrapped up the first day of talks in Geneva aimed at defusing a trade war that threatens to hammer the global economy and planned to resume negotiations on Sunday, a source close to the discussions said.

Putin proposes direct talks with Ukraine on May 15 to end war after three yearsRussian President Vladimir Putin has proposed direct peace talks with Ukraine on May 15 in Istanbul, aiming to resolve the conflict and restore lasting peace.

Before ceasefire came India's Israel-like shift in policy towards PakistanIndia and Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire after three days of military conflict across the border following India's Operation Sindoor strikes against terror infrastructure, which came in retaliation to the Pahalgam attack.

Soldier injured in firing at Nagrota Army station in Jammu, manhunt on for intruderA brief exchange of gunfire took place at the Nagrota Army Station in Jammu, injuring a soldier. A manhunt has been launched for the suspect who attempted to trespass into the station.

Virat Kohli could be India's knight in shining armour vs England: Navjot SidhuAs India gear up for a tough Test series in England, the uncertainty around Virat Kohli's future in red-ball cricket continues to dominate headlines, with calls growing louder for him to stay on.

Bangladesh bans Sheikh Hasina's Awami League under anti-terrorism lawBangladesh's interim government under Muhammad Yunus has banned Sheikh Hasina's Awami League under anti-terror laws, pending its trial in the International Crimes Tribunal.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Face of Pakistan's military is son of a terroristHeading Pakistan's disinformation campaign against India's anti-terror fight is Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry, the Director General of Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR). Chaudhry is the son of nuclear scientist Sultan Bashiruddin Mahmood, who met al-Qaida chief Osama bin Laden and tried to hand over nuclear weapons technology to terrorists. He features on the UN Security Council's al-Qaida Sanctions Committee list of terrorists.

This is no ceasefire: Omar Abdullah posts clip of air defence tackling Pak dronesJammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said explosions were heard in Srinagar just hours after Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire with India.

This is how Pakistan targeted India on the internet The disinformation campaign provides an insight into what might have been on Pakistan's agenda against India amid its slew of unsuccessful air raids.

Did $1-billion IMF loan to Pakistan come with ceasefire condition?Extensive damage to its military assets might have made Pakistan call for a ceasefire with India, but a $1-billion loan from the IMF might have helped in the de-escalation process. The loan might have come with a clause, asking Pakistan to seek an end to the fighting that had been going on for the last three days.

War is not India's choice: NSA Ajit Doval to China's Wang Yi amid tensions with PakNational Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi held a telephonic conversation amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

Ceasefire with Pak on our terms, PM made clear to NSA Ajit Doval, S JaishankarPM Modi made it clear to NSA Ajit Doval and S Jaishankar that a ceasefire will be agreed to "on our terms," sources told India Today.

sports.headline: Emotional Thomas Muller as Bayern lift Bundesliga title on his home farewellThe Allianz Arena erupted in tribute as Müller lifted the Bundesliga trophy one last time at home, closing a legendary chapter with Bayern Munich while fans and teammates honoured his unmatched legacy.

Virat Kohli could be India's knight in shining armour vs England: Navjot SidhuAs India gear up for a tough Test series in England, the uncertainty around Virat Kohli's future in red-ball cricket continues to dominate headlines, with calls growing louder for him to stay on.

After 104 days, Jannik Sinner makes strong comeback with thumping winItalian Open 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner defeated Argentina's Mariano Navone in straight sets on Saturday, May 10 and advanced to the Round of 32 of the clay-court tournament.

BCB pondering over Bangladesh's Pakistan tour amid security concernsThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) is still scratching its heads on the upcoming tour of Pakistan where the Tigers are set to participate in five T20Is from May 25 to June 3.

Why did Marta Kostyuk shake hands with 'Russian' Daria Kasatkina? ExplainedItalian Open 2025: Ukraine's Marta Kostyuk shook hands with Russia-born Daria Kasatkina after beating her 6-4, 6-2 in the Round of 64 clash on Friday, May 9.

Test cricket needs Kohli, he is going to average 60-plus here on: Brian LaraThe legendary Brian Lara said that Virat Kohli should be persuaded to not retire from Test cricket. Earlier, Kohli reached out to the BCCI with his desire to step away from the purest format of the game.

IPL 2025 likely to resume soon after India, Pakistan agree to ceasefireThe BCCI is set to decide the future of IPL 2025 following a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. This development could allow the tournament to resume nationwide after earlier disruptions.

Shubman, Rishabh to take charge of Indian team in post-Rohit eraShubman Gill is expected to take over as India captain following Rohit Sharma's retirement. The BCCI has also earmarked Rishabh Pant for the vice-captain's role in the Test team.

Virat Kohli, you have so much left: Ambati Rayudu amidst retirement rumoursAmbati Rayudu has appealed to Virat Kohli not to retire from Test cricket. The request comes amidst rumours following Rohit Sharma's retirement which signals a potential shift in India's Test team lineup.

Iga Swiatek makes shock exit, set for huge drop in rankingsItalian Open 2025: Defending champion Iga Swiatek crashed out after losing in straight sets to Danielle Collins of the USA in the Round of 32 clash on May 10.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
